sentence.Network_en: This letter will only make them think me a blackguard one.
sentence.Network_cn: 这封信不过使他们把我想得下流而已.

sentence.Network_en: It's no more than the vague charge of an angry blackguard.
sentence.Network_cn: 那只不过是一个恼羞成怒的诈骗犯所编造的含糊其辞的指控.

sentence.Network_en: He was one part blackguard, people said, and three parts buffoon.
sentence.Network_cn: 人家说他是一分流氓气, 三分小丑气.

list.abs: that monster of a mayor , that old blackguard of a mayor , is the cause of all .这个鬼市长，这个老流氓市长是一切的祸根。
she is an old blackguard of a woman ., 她是一个老毒妇.
I hit the blackguard square on his jaw .我恰好打中那个坏蛋的下巴。
the blackguards will do such things , I must allow .我承认这些坏蛋是会干这种事的。
it will be black day for the human race when scientific blackguards , conspirators , churls , and fanatics manage to supplant him .如果，有一天，科学的流氓们，阴谋者，吝啬者以及幻想家取代了他，那么人类这一种族也面临着堕落了。

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 16th cent. (originally as two words): from black + guardThe term originally denoted a body of attendants or servants, especially the menials who had charge of kitchen utensils, but the exact significance of the epithet 'black' is uncertain. In the sense 'scoundrel, villain' dates from the mid 18th cent., and was formerly considered highly offensive

sentences.sentence: "The satirists ridiculed the plans for a new opera house"
"The students poked fun at the inexperienced teacher"
"His former students roasted the professor at his 60th birthday"

means.word_mean: 2. use foul or abusive language towards;

sentences.sentence: "The actress abused the policeman who gave her a parking ticket"
"The angry mother shouted at the teacher"

auth_sentence.content: The minstrel, or menestrier, became very early a word of abuse, equivalent to blackguard.
